elbridge.map module¶

elbridge.plan module¶

class elbridge.plan.Plan(shapefile: str, n_districts: int, density_resolution: int, district_resolution: int, pop_col: str = 'total_pop', proj: str = 'esri:102003', contiguity: str = 'rook', pop_tolerance: float = 0.01, density_bitmap: str = '', district_bitmap: str = '')[source]¶

Bases: object

Represents a districting plan, which maps voting districts (VTDs) to congressional districts. For elbridge’s purposes, a districting plan contains a graph of VTDs and several continuously updated bitmaps that represent the plan’s geometry and population density.

Parameters:
  • shapefile – The path of the shapefile containing the plan’s underlying geographical and population data.
  • n_districts – The number of congressional districts to be allocated by the plan. This should correspond to the number of congressional districts allocated to the state based on the latest U.S. Census.
  • density_resolution – The approximate resolution (in pixels) of the population density bitmap used for area-based population estimations.
  • district_resolution – The approximate resolution (in pixels) of the bitmap used to render the districting plan (intended as input into a CNN-based model).
  • pop_col – The column in the shapefile with the total population of each VTD.
  • proj – The map projection used for the shapefile. Defaults to USA Contiguous Albers Equal Area Conic (ESRI:102003). If None, the shapefile’s original projection is retained.
  • contiguity – The contiguity criterion used to generate the adjacency matrix of the VTDs. Options: rook (contiguous edges) and queen (contiguous edges and vertices).
  • pop_tolerance – The tolerance on the equal population constraint. Defaults to 1%, which is roughly consistent with currently enacted districting plans.
  • density_bitmap – The path of a precomputed density bitmap. If the bitmap does not exist at the path, it is generated and saved at the path.
  • district_bitmap – The path of a precomputed district bitmap. If the bitmap does not exist at the path, it is generated and saved at the path.
